name: 許益瑞
objective: The course will be started from the review of senior high school chemistry. Then, the modern quantum chemistry will be introduced to make students familiarized the modern chemistry approach on the interpretation of the physical chemistry phenomena in material and biological science. This includes the introduction to quantum world, Schrodinger equation, chemical bonding, molecular shape and structure and so on. Later, the thermodynamics be applied to the interpretation of  physical and chemical equilibrium, acids and bases, aqueous equilibrium and electrochemistry.
schedule:
week 1 The shape of molecules
week 2  Theory of Covalent Bonding(I)
week 3  Theory of Covalent Bonding(II)
week 4  Organic Compounds and the Atomic Properties of Carbon (I)
week 5  Organic Compounds and the Atomic Properties of Carbon (II)
week 6  The Transition Elements and Their Coordination Compounds (I)
week 7  The Transition Elements and Their Coordination Compounds (II)
week 8  Special Selected Topic (I)
week 9  Midterm
week 10 Intermolecular Forces: Liquids, Solids, and Phase Changes
week 11 The properties of Mixtures: Solutions and Colloids
week 12 Rates and Mechanisms of Chemical Reactions(I)
week 13 Rates and Mechanisms of Chemical Reactions(II)
week 14 Thermodynamics : Entropy, Free Energy, and the Direction of Chemical Reactions (I)
week 15 Thermodynamics : Entropy, Free Energy, and the Direction of Chemical Reactions (II)
week 16 Electrochemistry : Chemical Change and Electrical Work
week 17 Special Selected Topic (II)
week 18 Final Exam.
materials: Textbook : Martin S. Silberberg, CHEMISTRY- The Molecular Nature of Matter and Change  5th ed.
